channel.desc: Whether its sports, esports, UCI, Ironman, F1, WRC, TV, music, festivals, films or videos, Red Bull TV has it all!

programme.title: Ride to the Roots
programme.desc: After winning her 10th word title, kitesurfer Gisela Pulido returns to her hometown of Premià de Mar, Spain to retrace the steps of her remarkable life. With the separate support of her mother and father, Gisela's career has been a dream come true.
programme.series-desc: Kitesurfer Gisela Pulido, the 10-times world title winner, returns home to retrace the story of her life.

programme.title: Pororoca
programme.desc: On every new and full moon, an enormous tidal wave occurs along the lower Amazon. It's a tempting target for surfers despite the many dangers involved, and it offers few who brave it the longest continuous rides of their lives.
programme.series-desc: A group of surfers travel to a remote part of the Amazon in an attempt to ride a destructive tidal wave.

programme.title: SCREENLAND
programme.desc: Before the advent of home consoles, video arcades were the gathering place for gamers. Once on the endangered species list, they are now enjoying a renaissance complete with Donkey Kong tournaments and new arcades that resurrect forgotten games.
programme.series-desc: Home gaming consoles may have put video arcades on the endangered list, but it's not 'game over' just yet.

programme.title: Márquez Unlimited
programme.sub-title: Marc Márquez's journey to his eighth world title
programme.desc: After undergoing major surgery and rehabilitation between seasons, Marc Márquez returned for the 2019 MotoGP™ season determined to claim back-to-back victories.
programme.series-desc: After surgery and rehabilitation, Marc Márquez returned ready for the 2019 MotoGP™ season.

programme.title: Lemawork Ketema: Keep on Running
programme.sub-title: The pursuit of an Olympic dream
programme.desc: Lemawork Ketema isn't just a good runner – he has the potential to compete with the best in the world. Fleeing Ethiopia due to oppressive conditions, he heads to Austria with the hope of becoming a citizen and fulfilling his Olympic dreams.
programme.series-desc: Lemawork Ketema isn't just a good runner – he has the potential to compete with the best in the world. Fleeing Ethiopia due to oppressive conditions, he heads to Austria with the hope of becoming a citizen and fulfilling his Olympic dreams.

programme.title: Rob Meets
programme.desc: Rob Warner travels to Palmerston North, New Zealand, to meet with freestyle motocross rider Levi Sherwood. The two talk about how Sherwood got to where he is at a young age and where he's headed.
programme.series-desc: Rob Warner travels to Palmerston North, New Zealand, to meet with freestyle motocross rider Levi Sherwood.

programme.title: Reel Rock
programme.desc: Czech Republic's Adam Ondra has set out to be the best climber in every aspect, and he has achieved that. Get inside Ondra's mind to find out what has fuelled him from such a young age.
programme.series-desc: Czech Republic's Adam Ondra has set out to be the best climber in every aspect, and he has achieved that.

programme.title: Reel Rock
programme.desc: Adam Ondra has learned to focus on climbing better technically, as well as building strength. Ondra challenges himself to flash a 9A+, which means he only gets one ascent to make it to the top.
programme.series-desc: Adam Ondra challenges himself to flash a 9A+, which means he only gets one ascent to make it to the top.

programme.title: Reel Rock
programme.desc: Adam Ondra heads to Canmore, Canada, to take on Fight Club, a 9B climb, and he plans to ascend the climb in just one day. Can he reach his ambitious goal?
programme.series-desc: Adam Ondra heads to Canmore, Canada, to take on Fight Club, a 9B climb, and master it in just one day.

programme.title: Red Bull Perspective: The Series
programme.desc: New York City is like an ever-changing skate park. Zered Bassett knows how this dynamic metropolis can have everything a skateboarder needs. See how growing up in the city changed the way he looks at the world as a professional skateboarder.
programme.series-desc: Zered Bassett was born and raised in New York City. See how this iconic town helped make him an iconic skater.

programme.title: Red Bull Perspective: The Series
programme.desc: Ryan Sheckler, Torey Pudwill, Zered Bassett, and Ryan Decenzo take a tour of Phoenix, Arizona, making the spots they hit their playground. Shot with Hollywood-level equipment, this film is a whole new way to see skateboarding.
programme.series-desc: See what happens when you combine Hollywood-level production and four of the best skateboarders in the game.

programme.title: Red Bull Perspective: The Series
programme.desc: Get a look at the making of the game changing film Red Bull Perspectives. Follow the crew as they head from California to Canada, New York City to Phoenix, filming four of the world's best skateboarders on their home turf, then on the road together.
programme.series-desc: Get a look at the making of the game changing film Red Bull Perspectives and the series profiling its stars.

programme.title: Rallying Around with Mike Chen
programme.desc: Mike takes a tour of the Citroën paddock at Rally Finland with Finnish driver Esapekka Lappi before enjoying a jetski adventure with Mikko Hirvonen and gaming with Kris Meeke.
programme.series-desc: Mike takes a tour of the Citroën paddock at Rally Finland with Esapekka Lappi before a jetski adventure with Mikko Hirvonen.

programme.title: Raditudes
programme.desc: Some of riding BMX is skill. The rest is persistence and luck. Pro BMX rider Kriss Kyle pushes himself to keep trying a pair of innovative lines at his local warehouse BMX park until he gets them right.
programme.series-desc: Pro BMX rider Kriss Kyle pushes himself to nail a pair of innovative lines at his local warehouse BMX park.

programme.title: Raditudes
programme.desc: In an abandoned warehouse in Nashville, Tennessee, United States, Corey Martinez films an epic BMX edit. It’s a DIY production with features made from materials found in the warehouse, and the results are a testament to his creative BMX passion.
programme.series-desc: Corey Martinez films a BMX edit in an abandoned warehouse, creating features out of materials he finds inside.

programme.title: Unbroken
programme.sub-title: The snowboard life of Mark McMorris
programme.desc: Look into the life of Mark McMorris at his most vulnerable and resilient as he battles to get back on his board. Candid interviews tell the story of one of the sport's most influential riders facing an existential crisis.
programme.series-desc: See Mark McMorris at his most vulnerable and resilient as he battles to get back on his board.

programme.title: Peaking
programme.desc: Chilean big-wave surfer Ramón Navarro has fought hard to get Chile a stop on the Big Wave Tour. Now, days before the Quiksilver Ceremonial competition, Ramon must wait and pray for a swell that may not materialise.
programme.series-desc: Days before the Quiksilver Ceremonial contest in Chile, surfer Ramón Navarro anxiously awaits a big swell.

programme.title: Follow Me
programme.desc: FMX rider Tom Pagès and drone pilot Thomas Panaiva got together to create a film in an undisclosed location that puts the viewer right in the heart of the action. Watch the fun the pair had behind the scenes.
programme.series-desc: Watch FMX rider Tom Pagès at work making a film with drone pilot Thomas Panaiva in an undisclosed location.

programme.title: Life Behind Bars
programme.desc: Ahead of the premiere for his film Rad Company, Brandon Semenuk cuts loose on some coastal loam with Graham Agassiz and Matty Miles. Along the way, Brandon shows behind-the-scenes footage of the coastal rain segment with guest rider Nico Vink.
programme.series-desc: Ahead of his film’s debut, Brandon Semenuk rides some coastal loam with Graham Agassiz and Matty Miles.

programme.title: Life Behind Bars
programme.desc: Brandon Semenuk and fellow MTB riders Logan and R Dog go home to British Columbia, Canada and reminisce about the past two seasons. In between runs at Whistler Mountain Bike Park, they share highlights from filming Life Behind Bars and Rad Company.
programme.series-desc: Brandon Semenuk and fellow MTB riders Logan and R Dog reminisce about the past two seasons.

programme.title: Levels
programme.desc: Peter Molyneux OBE, one of gaming's most controversial figures, has avoided the press for two years. The creator of the God Game genre attempts to win back fans as he introduces his newest studio and upcoming project, Legacy.
programme.series-desc: Peter Molyneux OBE talks about the creative process behind the development of his new game, Legacy.

programme.title: Levels
programme.sub-title: Why the world fell in love with Monument Valley
programme.desc: Ustwo Games talk about the pressure of trying to create two new games they hope will eclipse the success of their BAFTA-winning predecessor Monument Valley, while sharing the same DNA of being friendly, approachable and open to everyone.
programme.series-desc: Ustwo Games are creating two new games they hope will be even more successful than Monument Valley.

programme.title: Once Upon an Idea
programme.desc: Meet Shoaib Dar and learn about his organisation Pi Jam Foundation, which gives children access to a high quality computer education, nurturing generations of creators and problem solvers.
programme.series-desc: Find out about Pi Jam Foundation, an organisation that gives children access to computer education.

programme.title: Once Upon an Idea
programme.desc: Creative Director Geet Rathi, whose father suffered from ALS (Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis), invented a language for people who have lost the ability to speak. Now people can communicate by blinking.
programme.series-desc: Geet Rathi, whose father suffered from ALS, has invented a language for people who can't speak.

programme.title: Once Upon an Idea
programme.desc: Journalist Sruthi Krishnan and engineer-turned-researcher Bharath use gaming technology to explore how government policy-making can be made more relevant to people’s lives.
programme.series-desc: Computer scientists use gaming technology to explore how policy-making can be relevant to people’s lives.

programme.title: Far from Home
programme.desc: Born in Kampala, Uganda, Brolin Mawejje's life has been a tumultuous journey of highs and lows, rejection and acceptance. With the support of his community, Brolin is realising his dreams of becoming a doctor... and an Olympic snowboarder.
programme.series-desc: The true story of Brolin Mawejje, a Ugandan immigrant who found a life-changing passion in snowboarding.

programme.title: Red Bull Moto Spy
programme.desc: The top three Supercross competitors are nearly at a complete deadlock. Ken Roczen, Cooper Webb and Eli Tomac all want the victory for themselves, but the season isn't over yet.
programme.series-desc: Ken Roczen, Cooper Webb and Eli Tomac all want the victory for themselves, but the season isn't over yet.

programme.title: Red Bull Moto Spy
programme.desc: Partway through the 2020 AMA Supercross season, competition is on hold. See how the riders have done up to this point and what might lie ahead.
programme.series-desc: Partway through the 2020 AMA Supercross season, competition is on hold.

programme.title: Same Difference
programme.desc: Explore the three disciplines of modern skiing and how the skiers, their different stories and their mutual love of the sport create a link between them. Take a look into the lives of these athletes as they head into the wilderness.
programme.series-desc: The three disciplines of modern skiing are explored through the stories of top skiers.

programme.title: Searching for Sound
programme.desc: Producer-singer-songwriter Mitya explores the region of Tatarstan, Russia, where he grew up. Along the way, he collects audio samples, meets local musicians and finds inspiration for his own work.
programme.series-desc: Russia's promising musician explores the Tatarstan region of his homeland for lost songs and new inspiration.

programme.title: I AM...
programme.desc: BMX rider Drew Bezanson has a second home-like place: the podium at the Simple Session in Estonia. Since his first drop-in in 2010, he’s gone on to win an incredible five times.
programme.series-desc: Since his first BMX drop-in in 2010, Drew Bezanson has gone on to win an incredible five times.

programme.title: I AM...
programme.desc: Riding since the age of nine, Jonny Walker is the future of Hard Enduro. Take a journey with Jonny and find out what drives him to succeed.
programme.series-desc: Riding since the age of nine, Jonny Walker is the future of Hard Enduro.

programme.title: Gyros for Heroes
programme.desc: Chris Haslam, Sierra Fellers, Max Kruglov, Dima Rodionov, Yura Renov and Giorgio Zavos arrive in Crete to take advantage of the island's skate-friendly plazas and streets.
programme.series-desc: Chris Haslam and the crew arrive in Crete to take advantage of the island's skate-friendly plazas and streets.

programme.title: Gyros for Heroes
programme.desc: Chris Haslam, Max Kruglov and the crew find that keeping an eye out while sightseeing can uncover epic skate spots. Some banks, rails, and ledges spied by accident wind up resulting in killer shots.
programme.series-desc: When cruising through Crete, keeping an eye on the surroundings can mean finding the best skate spots.

programme.title: Generations of Freeskiing
programme.desc: Dive deep into the story of freestyle skiing, its origins, and how it continues to develop. In the fluid style of a top-to-bottom run that reaches across eras, take a thrilling ride through history.
programme.series-desc: Take a thrilling ride through the story of freestyle skiing, its origins and how it continues to develop.

programme.sub-title: The pursuit of an Olympic dream
programme.desc: Lemawork Ketema isn't just a good runner – he has the potential to compete with the best in the world. Fleeing Ethiopia due to oppressive conditions, he heads to Austria with the hope of becoming a citizen and fulfilling his Olympic dreams.

programme.title: Peaking
programme.desc: Chilean big-wave surfer Ramón Navarro has fought hard to get Chile a stop on the Big Wave Tour. Now, days before the Quiksilver Ceremonial competition, Ramon must wait and pray for a swell that may not materialise.
programme.series-desc: Days before the Quiksilver Ceremonial contest in Chile, surfer Ramón Navarro anxiously awaits a big swell.

programme.title: Pushing the Limits
programme.desc: From free diving to freeskiing, kite surfing to kayaking, action sports athletes and adventurers have a relationship with nature that's hard for most to comprehend: one driven by the need to leave comfort zones and expand the realms of possibility.
programme.series-desc: Take a look at the people who are expanding the boundaries of capability and performance in action sports.

programme.title: Bella Vita
programme.desc: The waves of the Italian coast call surfer Chris Del Moro on a pilgrimage back to his ancestral homeland, where he explores how old-world conventions and traditions have given rise to a unique modern surf lifestyle and destination.
programme.series-desc: The waves of the Italian coast call surfer Chris Del Moro on a pilgrimage back to his ancestral homeland.

programme.title: Saturdays
programme.desc: Featuring the legendary Tony Hawk and some of the most progressive skateboarding ever captured, Saturdays was shot over three years on location at iconic spots across the globe. Check out this long-awaited new film from Birdhouse Skateboards here.
programme.series-desc: Check out some of the most progressive skateboarding ever captured on film.

programme.title: Originate
programme.desc: Follow Michelle and the crew through the trials and tribulations of producing and shooting in 100mph winds and heavy snow flurries. Will they pull it off?
programme.series-desc: Follow Michelle and the crew through the trials and tribulations of producing and shooting Chris Benchetler's film Fire On The Mountain in 100mph winds and heavy snow flurries. Will they pull it off?

programme.title: Under an Arctic Sky
programme.sub-title: Searching for waves in the storm
programme.desc: A group of surfers, along with photographer Chris Burkard, journey to Iceland’s north coast in search of perfect waves during the country's largest storm in 25 years.
programme.series-desc: A group of surfers, along with photographer Chris Burkard, journey to Iceland in search of perfect waves.

programme.title: One Final Run
programme.desc: As Bomber faces mandatory military service in South Korea, others reflect on his legacy, and Bomber speaks about what it means to end his pro gaming career and why he still fights on in the StarCraft II scene.
programme.series-desc: Bomber discusses the end of his pro gaming career and why he still fights on in the StarCraft II scene.

programme.title: One Final Run
programme.desc: Bomber and Life make it to BlizzCon, where the pressure's on in the first round with intense matches. Bomber is on a roll, but can he actually make it through to the finals and take a world championship? Can Life vanquish a series of tough opponents?
programme.series-desc: Bomber and Life have made it to BlizzCon, where the pressure is on with intense StarCraft II matches.

programme.title: One Final Run
programme.desc: A career in pro gaming can be an amazing, joyous ride, despite the hard work it takes to make it to the top. Choi 'Bomber' Ji Sung’s fate is decided by the Korean government, but Lee 'Life' Seung Hyun still has a chance to be a StarCraft II champion.
programme.series-desc: Though Choi 'Bomber' Ji Sung must quit StarCraft II, Lee 'Life' Seung Hyun still has a chance to be champion.

programme.title: The Green Cape
programme.sub-title: Skating in Senegal and Cape Verde
programme.desc: One for the record books, this first-ever pro skateboarding tour of Senegal and the Cape Verde islands produced all the incredible visuals and culture clashes which make for an unforgettable skate trip.
programme.series-desc: Red Bull athlete Zion Wright debuts on a skateboarding trip, going from Senegal to the Cape Verde islands.

programme.title: Underdogs
programme.desc: Téo Frank was only 18 when he, an aspiring French director, decided to take a trip across the Atlantic to film a documentary about hip-hop culture. From this adventure his film Underdogs was born.
programme.series-desc: French director Téo Frank was only 18 when he crossed the Atlantic to film a documentary on hip-hop culture.

programme.title: On the Road Stories
programme.desc: Have you heard the story about one of the youngest people to climb Mount Everest? Get to know Indian mountaineer Shivangi Pathak and find out how she overcame adversity to summit the fabled peak in 2016.
programme.series-desc: Have you heard the story about one of the youngest people to climb Mount Everest? Meet Shivangi Pathak.

programme.title: On the Road Stories
programme.desc: Ultramarathon runner Shubham Kajale reveals how he came face to face with a shark while taking part in a gruelling event in Australia in 2018.
programme.series-desc: Shubham Kajale tells the story of his meeting with a shark during an ultramarathon.

programme.title: On the Road Stories
programme.desc: How did the national Indian football team get into a not-so-Mexican stand-off in a foreign country? Goalkeeper Gurpreet Singh Sandhu tells us.
programme.series-desc: Goalkeeper Gurpreet Singh Sandhu describes how he and the Indian national team got stuck in Oman back in 2015.

programme.title: Official Skatepark Review
programme.desc: Joey Brezinski, Kelly Hart and, of course, their pal 'Rip' hit up Poods Park in Encinitas, California, to see what the place has to offer for some sick skateboarding tricks.
programme.series-desc: Joey Brezinski, Kelly Hart and, of course, their pal 'Rip' hit up Poods Park in Encinitas, California.

programme.title: Official Skatepark Review
programme.desc: We head down to Leucadia, California, to check out the local skatepark with pro skateboarder Kenny Hoyle. The park is largely referred to as 'The Ashtray' by locals – can you guess why?
programme.series-desc: We head down to Leucadia, California, to check out the local skatepark with pro skateboarder Kenny Hoyle.
